title: Making a Gill Net from Parachute Cord
brief: Construct a fishing net using parachute suspension line when commercial nets aren't available.
steps: Step 1: Remove core lines from parachute suspension line, tie outer casing between two trees.
Step 2: Attach multiple core lines to the casing using prusik knots or girth hitches, spacing them evenly.
Step 3: Starting at one end, tie second and third core lines together with overhand knots.
Step 4: Continue tying fourth to fifth, sixth to seventh, until reaching the end with single lines at each end.
Step 5: Start second row with first core line, tie it to second, third to fourth, and continue the pattern.
Step 6: Use a moveable guideline positioned opposite your working side to keep rows even and regulate mesh size.
Step 7: Continue tying rows until net reaches desired width, thread suspension line along bottom for strength.
warnings: Requires significant time and patience to construct properly.
Mesh size must match target fish species - too large and small fish escape, too small and net clogs.
Keep consistent tension throughout construction for even mesh pattern.
